project1.title: Lego Builder
project1.description: This is an app where you can change the lego parts displayed by selecting specific parts from the dropdown buttons. You can save your favorite character! Practiced with promises and axios calls and intro to sass.
project1.technologiesUsed: HTML, CSS, JS, Jquery, JSON, Promises, Axios, Postman

project2.title: Simple Pinterest
project2.description: A simple mock up of the look and functionality of Pinterest. You can check out the boards and upon clicking them, you will see the pins for that board. A project that introduced us to using Promises
project2.technologiesUsed: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Jquery, JSON, Promises, Bootstrap

project3.title: Shotz
project3.description: How to find the best locations for your movie shots! Alternate between shooting locations and the movies filmed there. Used promises and JSON.
project3.technologiesUsed: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Jquery, JSON, Modules, Promises

project4.title: What You See Is What You Get
project4.description: The story of Tomoe Gozen! Click and play around. DOM manipulation using Javascript, event listeners, and JSON files
project4.technologiesUsed: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, JSON, Modules, Bootstrap

project5.title: Thrones
project5.description: A Game of Thrones site where you can sort characters based on their house. Project utilized to give us more experience with JS event listeners
project5.technologiesUsed: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, JSON, Modules, Bootstrap

project6.title: Adoption Website
project6.description: An adoption website where you are able to sort based on pet type (cat, dino, dog, or all). Very similar to the Thrones project in that it gave us more experience with event listeners.
project6.technologiesUsed: HTML, CSS, Vanilla JavaScript, Version Control with Github, Bootstrap

project7.title: Sorting Hat
project7.description: A project that brings Hogwarts' Sorting Hat to life! Users are able to sort students into Houses and expel them. Worked with event listeners (particularly click events).
project7.technologiesUsed: HTML, CSS, Vanilla JavaScript, Version Control with Github

project8.title: Language Translator
project8.description: An app that uses a limited dictionary and then translates a holiday card message from English into another language.
project8.technologiesUsed: HTML, CSS, Vanilla JavaScript, Version Control with Github
